title: Reading Comprehension: Fiction Stories

vocab.definition: Stories that are made up or imagined, not real
A person or animal in a story
When and where a story takes place
The sequence of events that happen in a story
The most important point or message of a story

teachingNotes: Practice identifying story elements. Use graphic organizers to help students track characters, setting, and plot. Encourage students to make predictions while reading.

sample.question: What do we call stories that are made up or imagined?

truefalse.question: The setting tells us when and where a story happens.

multiplechoice.question: What is the sequence of events in a story called?

fillintheblank.question: The most important point or message of a story is the ________ idea.

shortanswer.question: What are the three main parts of any story?
